tit.cmt: 申次衆→Moshitsugishu 統一用語リストにはMoshitsugishu (a civil servant post in Muromachi Shogunate)とありましたが、ここでは、読みのローマ字表記だけにしました。

sen.j: 申次衆（もうしつぎしゅう）とは、室町幕府の職名の1つ。
sen.e: Moshitsugishu (申次衆) is the name of a post in Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 室町幕府→Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.e: Moshitsugishu was the name of a post in Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.e: "Moshitsugishu" was the name of a post in Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 統一リスト（その他 2009/6/29）の指示により、Moshitsugishu にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。

sen.j: 申次とは奏者とも呼ばれ、元来は天皇や太上天皇に奏聞を取次ぐ役目をする人物を指し、鎌倉幕府や室町幕府でも征夷大将軍に奏聞を取次ぐ人を指した。
sen.e: Moshitsugi, also called sosha/soja, originally referred to a person in charge of conveying some information to the Emperor or Taijo Tenno (the retired Emperor), and in Kamakura bakufu and Muromachi bakufu it also referred to a person conveying some information to Seii taishogun (literally, 'great general who subdues the barbarians').
sen.cmt: 奏者→sosha/soja （2種類の読み方があるようなので併記しました）。また統一用語リストのsosha(an usher in charge of informing a shogun or daimyo (feudal lord) of the name of visitors to the residence before meeting)のカッコ内は省略しました。 奏聞を取次ぐ人→定訳不明：a person in charge of conveying some information to (地位のある人）としました。
sen.e: Moshitsugi, also called sosha/soja, originally referred to a person in charge of conveying messages to the Emperor or Taijo Tenno (the retired Emperor), and in the Kamakura and Muromachi bakufu it also referred to a person conveying messages to the Seii taishogun.

sen.e: Moshitsugi, also called sosha/soja, originally referred to a person in charge of conveying messages to the Emperor or Daijo Tenno (the Retired Emperor), and in the Kamakura and Muromachi bakufu it also referred to a person conveying messages to the seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians").
sen.cmt: Taijo Tenno (the retired Emperor) を Daijo Tenno (the Retired Emperor) に修正しました。the Seii taishogun を the seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") に修正しました。

sen.j: 幕府の申次は将士が将軍に拝謁するために参上した際にその姓名を将軍に報告して拝謁を取り次ぎ、同時に関連する雑務も処理した。
sen.e: Moshitsugi in the bakufu also carried out general miscellaneous task, while taking charge of informing the shogun of the name of the officers and men who came to seek an audience with the shogun, and ushered them to the audience.
Moshitsugi in the bakufu also carried out miscellaneous tasks, informed the shogun of the names of people who sought an audience with him, and ushered them to the audience.

sen.j: 室町幕府6代将軍足利義教の頃には伊勢氏・上野氏・大舘氏・畠山氏の4氏出身者によって独占されるようになり、彼らは数名で結番して交代で申次の職務にあたった。
sen.e: During the period of the sixth shogun of Muromachi bakufu, Yoshinori ASHIKAGA, the post was monopolized by four clans, the Ise clan, Ueno clan, Odachi clan and Hatakeyama clan, and they took the charge of Moshitsugi in turn, forming a group composed of several persons to take shifts on night duty.
sen.cmt: 数名で結番して→定訳不明：forming a group composed of several persons to take shifts on night dutyとしました。

sen.j: これを申次衆と呼び、後に御相伴衆・御供衆・御部屋衆に次ぐ家格としての意味を有するようになった。
sen.e: They were called Moshitsugishu, and later it became a term referring to the rank of the family, ranked after Oshobanshu (officials who accompany shogun), Otomoshu (attendant group, who attended the shogun to go up to the ancient capital Kyoto), Oheyashu (the position in charge of keeping the night watch of the shogun's bedchamber).
sen.cmt: 御相伴衆は統一用語リストでは Gohobanshu (officials who accompany shogun), あるいはgoshobanshu と2通りありましたが、読み方は「ごしょうばんしゅう」Goshobanshuとしました。 御供衆は、統一用語リストではhe shogun Takauji Ashikagaとありましたが、足利尊氏のほかの将軍の場合もあることを考え、Otomoshu (attendant group, who attended the shogun Takauji Ashikaga to go up to the ancient capital Kyoto)→Otomoshu (attendant group, who attended the shogun to go up to the ancient capital Kyoto)としました。

sen.j: 近年では、伊勢盛時（北条早雲）も申次衆の1人であったと考えられている。
sen.e: Nowadays, it is considered that Moritoki ISE (Soun HOJO) was also one of the Moshitsugishu, for a time.
